meanings.definition: A speech or piece of writing that is similar in content or style to another.
meanings.sent1: She delivered an isologue at the conference, echoing the main points of the keynote speaker.
meanings.sent2: The student's essay was an isologue of the famous author's work, with similar themes and writing style.
meanings.sent3: The isologue at the meeting was so similar to the boss's speech that everyone started to chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her presentation was like an isologue of the CEO's address, mirroring his tone and message.
meanings.sent5: The isologue she gave was so identical to the original speech that it was hard to tell them apart.

meanings.definition: To speak or write in a manner that is similar to another.
meanings.sent1: He tends to isologue his brother's way of speaking when they spend a lot of time together.
meanings.sent2: The author intentionally isologues the writing style of her favorite novelist in her latest book.
meanings.sent3: It's amusing to watch him isologue his friend's jokes, trying to be as funny as him.
meanings.sent4: She isologues her mentor's teaching style, making her own lessons more effective.
meanings.sent5: The student isologues the professor's explanations, making it easier for others to understand the topic.
